response.title: Ensure the registration Call to Action (CTA) is prominently displayed and easily accessible on all pages of the website for non-logged-in users.
response.observation: The 'Register' button is prominently displayed in the header on the main page, making it easily accessible to new users.
response.suggestions: No changes needed; the CTA is well-placed.

response.title: Ensure the registration area opens in the same tab or window, providing a seamless user experience without redirecting users to a new tab, window, or modal/popup.
response.observation: The registration form opens in a modal/popup, maintaining user context without redirecting to a new page.
response.suggestions: No changes needed; the modal approach keeps the user experience seamless.

response.title: Ensure the registration page content is straightforward and easy to understand.
response.observation: The registration page clearly labels each field, uses simple language, and includes visual cues to guide users.
response.suggestions: Consider adding tooltips for additional guidance on specific fields.

response.title: Ensure that the registration process to maintain user control and awareness for multi-step registrations.
response.observation: The registration is a two-step process, but there are no clear indicators showing progress through the steps.
response.suggestions: Include a progress bar or step indicators to show users which step they are on.

response.title: Ensure that the registration process includes easily accessible live help options.
response.observation: There is a 'Live Support' option in the sidebar, making it somewhat accessible during registration.
response.suggestions: Ensure live support options are directly linked or highlighted within the registration form for immediate assistance.

response.title: Review the registration form to confirm it is simple and user-friendly.
response.observation: The form is straightforward with essential fields such as email, username, password, and date of birth. Optional fields are clearly marked.
response.suggestions: No further simplification needed; the form is user-friendly.

response.title: Review the registration form to confirm that all fields include appropriate hints, guidelines, or examples.
response.observation: Some fields contain guidelines such as password requirements, but examples for email and username formats are missing.
response.suggestions: Include examples for email (e.g., user@example.com) and username formats.

response.title: Review the registration form to ensure that fields are designed appropriately.
response.observation: The forms use appropriate fields like dropdowns for date selection, maintaining a user-friendly design.
response.suggestions: No changes needed; field design is appropriate.

response.title: Review the registration form to ensure there is a clear distinction between 'required' and 'optional' fields.
response.observation: Optional fields are labeled as 'Optional,' whereas required fields are not explicitly labeled but are mandatory.
response.suggestions: Consider adding an asterisk (*) next to required fields for additional clarity.

response.title: Review the registration form to ensure that all text boxes are appropriately sized for the expected input.
response.observation: Text boxes are appropriately sized; for instance, date fields and email fields differ in size according to expected input length.
response.suggestions: No changes needed; text box sizing is appropriate.

response.title: Ensure that data formats are clearly indicated for input.
response.observation: Date format guidance appears to be lacking, which could confuse users about how to input dates.
response.suggestions: Add placeholders or format hints (e.g., DD/MM/YYYY) for date input fields.

response.title: Ensure that users can complete simple tasks by entering only essential information.
response.observation: The registration focuses on essential fields with optional fields clearly marked, streamlining the user experience.
response.suggestions: No changes needed; the form focuses on essential information.

response.title: Ensure there is a clearly visible password strength indicator that includes expected security parameters.
response.observation: The form includes a password section but lacks a strength indicator showing important security parameters.
response.suggestions: Incorporate a password strength indicator with visual cues and security requirements.

response.title: Make sure the website shows clear error messages when fields are filled out incorrectly or incompletely.
response.observation: Error messages appear clearly when fields are filled out incorrectly, providing specific guidance on what needs correction.
response.suggestions: No changes needed; error messages are clear and helpful.
